Action.author: alacambra
Action.body: ~sanchezl , ~muralisr , ~C0rWin can you check if this fix proposal would make sense?

Action.author: muralisr
Action.body: ~alacambra but given that go chaincode works, have you looked at that to make sure this fix is compatible with that and add a few words on that (and if not, why) please ?

Action.author: alacambra
Action.body: Yes ~muralisr . Basically is the same api. The only difference is that in go no CompositeKey object exist and it past the key as strings. In java such an object exit and it can be created from a string. My suggestion would be to add an overloaded method accepting directly this object. Except that and the bug fix no more methods are being change.

Action.author: c0rwin
Action.body: /cc ~gennadyl can you please take a look on this one?

Action.author: gennadyl
Action.body: getStateByPartialCompositeKey(String compositeKey) { return getStateByPartialCompositeKey(new CompositeKey(compositeKey)); } {code} string argument will be threaten as objectType part of CompositeKey. At least it will cause confusion. >

Action.author: alacambra
Action.body: ~gennadyl I have published the changes of the review. https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/c/26292/ For some reason it has created a new review instead a new Patch set ...

Action.author: gennadyl
Action.body: ~alacambra Can you rebase it on top of current master?

Action.author: alacambra
Action.body: ~gennadyl I will try to do it tonight. Some magic command to do that without that creates a new review?

Action.author: alacambra
Action.body: Solve this merge is like to be in a fancy party. Best plan ever :)

Action.author: denyeart
Action.body: ~gennadyl ~C0rWin ~alacambra I didn't follow the comments... from your perspective is this one ready to get merged into master and release-1.3?

Action.author: c0rwin
Action.body: ~denyeart yes, it looks good. merged for v1.3.
